revisions.rev:
{{Infobox surfer | name = Kelly Slater | image= Kelly slater.jpg | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1972|02|11}} | birth_place = [[Cocoa Beach, Florida]], [[United States|U.S.]] | residence = Florida, California and Hawaii | height = {{height|ft=5|in=9}} | weight = {{convert|160|lb|kg|abbr=on}} | years_active=1990âpresent | best_year = Ranked 1st on the [[ASP World Tour]], 1992, 1994, 1995, 1996, 1997, 1998, 2005, 2006, 2008, 2010, 2011 | career_earnings=$3,030,755 (as of 2011) [http://www.aspworldtour.com/rankings/asp-mens-world-ranking/ ASP Menâs World Ranking | ASP World Tour â The Association of Surfing Professionals]. ASP World Tour. Retrieved on 2011-08-16.
| sponsors=[[Quiksilver]] wetsuits and clothing, FCS fins and Komunity Project accessories | major_achievements = 11 time ASP World Champion
Victories: 55
[[World championship tour (WCT) surfing]] wins: 48 | stance =Regular (natural) foot (left foot forward) | shapers=Al Merrick | quiver= 5'6", 5'8", 5'10", 6'1", 6'3" and 6'6" boards when on the road | occupation= [[Actor]] | favorite_waves=Kirra and Pipe | favorite_maneuvers=Airs and barrels | website=[http://www.kellyslater.com/ kellyslater.com] }} '''Robert Kelly Slater''' (born February 11, 1972, [[Cocoa Beach]], [[Florida|FL]], [[United States|USA]]) is an American professional [[surfer]] known for his competitive prowess and style. He has been crowned [[ASP World Tour|ASP]] World Champion a record 11 times, including 5 consecutive titles from 1994â98. He is the youngest (at age 20) and the oldest (at age 39) to win the title. Upon winning his 5th world title in 1997, Slater passed Australian surfing legend [[Mark Richards (surfer)|Mark Richards]] to become the most successful champion in the history of the sport. In 2007 he also became the all-time leader in career event wins by winning the Boost Mobile Pro event at [[Trestles|Lower Trestles]] near [[San Clemente]], California. The previous record was held by Slater's childhood hero, 3-time world champion [[Tom Curren]].Sports Illustrated, September 24, 2007, p. 24 In addition to the ASP tour, Slater has also competed in the [[X-Games]] (in 2003 and 2004). After earlier being awarded the title prematurely as a result of a miscalculation by the [[Association of Surfing Professionals|ASP]], on November 6, 2011 Slater officially won his eleventh ASP world title at the Rip Curl Pro Search San Francisco, by winning his 4th round heat. In May 2005, in the final heat of the [[Billabong (clothing)|Billabong]] Tahiti Pro contest at [[Teahupo'o]], Slater became the first surfer ever to be awarded two perfect scores for a total 20 out of 20 points under the [[Association of Surfing Professionals|ASP]] two-wave scoring system. (The corresponding honor under the previous three-wave system belongs to fellow American [[Shane Beschen]] who achieved the feat in 1996.) Since 1990, Slater has been sponsored primarily by surfwear industry giant [[Quiksilver]].{{cite web|url=http://www.quiksilver.com/team/riders.aspx?id=7 |title=Quiksilver Rider's Gallery |accessdate=2007-10-20 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20071011134424/http://www.quiksilver.com/team/riders.aspx?id=7 |archivedate = October 11, 2007}} He exclusively rides Channel Islands [[surfboard]]s equipped with his own signature series of FCS fins. ==Biography== ===Early life and family=== [[Image:Boost Mobile Pro 2008.jpg|thumb|left|Kelly Slater with fellow pro surfers [[Rob Machado]] and [[Christiaan Bailey]]]] Slater was born on February 11, 1972 in Cocoa Beach, Florida, where he continues to reside. He has a teenage daughter named Taylor. He is of [[Irish people|Irish]] and [[Syrian]] ancestry. He has a twin brother Daley, an older brother, Sean, and a younger brother, Stephen. In his spare time Slater enjoys playing the guitar and getting ripped out of the water by Mike Rowley, the leader of "Seagull Pu Cru" in Satellite Beach, Florida. Despite the competition at home in Cocoa Beach, he still "shreds the Narrz". His favorite surf spots are Sandspit in California, [[Banzai Pipeline|Pipeline]] in [[Hawaii]], [[Kirra, Queensland|Kirra]] in [[Australia]], [[Jeffreys Bay]] in [[South Africa]], Minis in Ireland, Taghazout in Morocco, Soup Bowls in [[Barbados]], [[Sebastian Inlet]] near his home in Florida and Bilgola beach in the northern beaches of Sydney, Australia.{{Cite news| title = Brevard's own Kelly Slater: Surfing Superman, regular guy | url = http://www.floridatoday.com/!NEWSROOM/special/surfing/localcoverage/052902slaterprofile.htm | publisher = Florida Today | first = Hillard | last = Grossman | date = 2002-05-26 | accessdate = 2007-02-07 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20060701070402/http://www.floridatoday.com/!NEWSROOM/special/surfing/localcoverage/052902slaterprofile.htm |archivedate = July 1, 2006}} He is also an avid golfer, with a +2 handicap. Slater is interested in the sport of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu. Some of his surfing inspirations are [[Tom Curren]], [[Tom Carroll (surfer)|Tom Carroll]], [[Mark Occhilupo]], [[Martin Potter (surfer)|Martin Potter]], [[Andy Irons]], [[Shane Dorian]], Mark Davis and Bob Gerrard.[http://www.aspnorthamerica.org/profiles_show.php?id=4 ASP North America]. ASP North America (1972-02-11). Retrieved on 2011-08-16. ===Other projects=== Slater played the recurring character Jimmy Slade on several episodes of the popular TV show ''[[Baywatch]]'' in the early 1990s .[http://baywatchun.tripod.com/actors/slater_kelly.html baywatch database: actors: Kelly Slater]. Baywatchun.tripod.com (1972-11-02). Retrieved on 2011-08-16. He appeared in an episode of the reality show The Girls Next Door, and has also starred in many surf films throughout his career. In the late '90s Slater, along with friends and fellow pro surfers Rob Machado and Peter King, formed a band called The Surfers. The trio released an album in 1998 titled ''Songs From the Pipe'', a reference to the famous surf spot Pipeline on Oahu, Hawaii. Slater performed a song with [[Ben Harper]] during Harper's concert in [[Santa Barbara, California|Santa Barbara]]. on August 1, 2006. He also performed "Rockin' in The Free World" with [[grunge]] band [[Pearl Jam]] on the July 7, 2006 in [[San Diego, California|San Diego]]. In 1999, he appeared alongside [[Garbage (band)|Garbage]] singer [[Shirley Manson]] in the promotional video for the band's single "[[You Look So Fine]]". He played a man washed up on a seashore, then rescued by Manson. A video game named [[Kelly Slater's Pro Surfer]], by [[Treyarch]] and published by [[Activision]], was released in 2002. Slater also appeared as a playable character in [[Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3]] prior to this, complete with a surfboard. In 2003 Slater released his autobiography, ''Pipe Dreams: A Surfer's Journey''. In 2008 he released a second book with Phil Jarratt, entitled ''Kelly Slater: For the Love.'' Slater is passionate about preserving oceans globally and protecting temperate reefs in California through his relationship with Reef. On May 8, 2010 the [[United States House of Representatives]] honored Slater in H. Res. 792 for his "outstanding and unprecedented achievements in the world of surfing and for being an ambassador of the sport and excellent role model." {{cite web|url=http://gamepolitics.com/2010/06/03/dems-repubs-toss-aside-differences-honor-surfer |title=Dems, Repubs Toss Aside Differences to Honor Surfer |date=2010-06-03 |work=GamePolitics.com |accessdate=2010-06-03}} This resolution, sponsored by Florida representative [[Bill Posey]] and sponsored by 10 representatives passed without objection by a [[voice vote]].{{cite web|url=http://www.govtrack.us/congress/bill.xpd?bill=hr111-792 |title=H. Res. 792 |author=Govtrack.us |date=2010-05-19 |accessdate=2010-06-03}} ===Stats=== [[Image:KellySlater byRobKeaton.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Slater surfing in the [[Boost Mobile]] Pro at [[Trestles]] ]] [[File:Kelly Slater.jpg|thumb|right|300px|Slater at [[Trestles]], [[San Clemente State Beach]], [[California]]]] *[[World championship tour (WCT) surfing|WCT]] victories: 48 *World titles: 11 On 9/15/07, Kelly Slater passed Tom Curren's long standing WCT tour victory record of 33 with his win at the Boost Mobile Pro at Lowers Trestles. ===2011 Stats and results=== World ranking: 2011 Champion
